2025-10-26

Jazz at the Museum

Jazz at the Museum is a recurring jazz concert series running from August 23, 2025 through April 25, 2026. DMA fills its halls with the soulfoul sounds of live jazz every other month, featuring talented local bands. These events bring the halls of the DMA to life with live jazz bands in a lounge-inspired setting‚Äîcomplete with a full bar, light bites, and access to select exhibitions. Extras: Access to exhibitions, VIP dining options Pricing: $36 to $140; member discounts available

Venue: Dallas Museum of Art, 1717 N. Harwood St., Dallas, TX
City: Dallas
Area: Arts District

Hay Literary Festival

Step into a world of different experiences at Hay Festival Forum Dallas 2025. Taking place across the Bishop Arts District October 17-19, the program of 30 events features writers, musicians and activists in conversations, performances and book clubs.

New Orleans Music & Culture Fest

The 2025 New Orleans Music & Culture Fest brings the magic of the Crescent City to the heart of Texas for an unforgettable one-day event. This immersive, family-friendly celebration honors New Orleans' rich cultural legacy through live performances, food, art, and heritage. Ticketing required. VIP access available.

Venue: Levy Event Plaza, 501 E Las Colinas Blvd
City: Irving
Area: Las Colinas

Free and family-friendly! Enjoy live Latin music, salsa lessons around 6:30‚ÄØPM, DJs, food trucks, and vendors offering a festive atmosphere. When? Every 2nd Saturday in June, July, August, and September, from 6:00‚ÄØPM to 10:00‚ÄØPM. 2025 Lineup Highlights: June 14: Havana NRG (Latin orchestra) July 12: Latin Swing August 9: Zone D‚ÄôMambo September 13: Yamilka G & Orquesta Parking: Free general parking at Vitruvian Park‚Äôs Bella Lane and Ponte Avenue lots. Venue: Vitruvian Park

2025-09-13

Riverfront Jazz Festival

Held Labor Day weekend, this musical event is jam-packed with some of the world's best national and international jazz artists of all sub-genres! Discover renowned artists from all over the world performing jazz, R&B, soul, blues and neo-soul. Experience awe-inspiring music from promising young artists from Dallas/Fort Worth area schools and music programs, taking to the stage to showcase their talent. Attend the festival's opening night dancing to your favorite Tina Turner songs and grooving to an engaging performance from R&B artist Stephanie Mills. Dive into weekend-long excitement with performers such as The Voice star Kevin Hawkins, electric blues singer Shemeika Copeland, and jazz-funk artist Jeff Lorber.

Venue: Fair Park
City: Dallas
Area: South
